thread.title: 2015 Elections: Burtis vs. Szczesniak for Onondaga County Legislature 3rd District
thread.title_full: 2015 Elections: Burtis vs. Szczesniak for Onondaga County Legislature 3rd District | syracuse.com

author: Michelle Breidenbach | mbreidenbach@syracuse.com
title: 2015 Elections: Burtis vs. Szczesniak for Onondaga County Legislature 3rd District
text:
Republican Legislator Tim Burtis faces Democratic challenger Ed Szczesniak in the Onondaga County Legislature's 3rd District.
Burtis, 9444 Hawkeye Drive, Brewerton, was appointed to the Legislature in January by County Executive Joanie Mahoney to replace former Legislator Jim Corl, who accepted a job in the courts. Burtis is seeking his first election to the seat.
Burtis was deputy supervisor in the town of Cicero. He is director of outside loan sales at Empower Federal Credit Union.
He faces a familiar name in Democratic politics. Szczesniak, of 6243 Hessler Farm Path, Cicero, is running for the seat. Szczesniak is the retired Democratic commissioner of the Onondaga County Board of Elections , a job he held for 16 years.
Szczesniak ran an unsuccessful race for the 3rd District in 2009 against Legislator Bill Meyer.
The 3rd District represents parts of the towns of Cicero and Manlius.
Party enrollment in the district favors Republicans, but not by much.
Thirty-four percent (5,485) of registered voters are Republican; 29 percent (4,814) are Democrat and 27 percent (4,366) are not enrolled in a party.
Contact Michelle Breidenbach 315-470-3186
